Trial_Design.evidence: We conducted a prospective, single-arm, phase II trial.

Participants.evidence: Fifty-three patients had clinical T1N0 lesions, and 4 had T2N0 lesions in the low rectum, located below the peritoneal reflection.

Intervention.evidence: 57 patients were treated with local excision after additional external beam irradiation (45 Gy) plus continuous 5-week intravenous injection of 5-fluorouracil (250 mg/m 2 per day)

Objective.evidence: The purpose of this study was to determine the efficacy of chemoradiotherapy combined with local excision in the treatment of T1 to T2 low rectal cancer.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary end point was disease-free survival at 5 years.

Number_Randomised.evidence: From April 2003 to October 2010, 57 patients were treated

Number_Analysed.evidence: The completion rate for full-dose chemoradiotherapy was 86% (49/57).

Result_Outcome.evidence: the 5-year disease-free survival rate was 94% for the 53 patients with T1 lesions and 75% for the 4 patients with T2 lesions.

Harms.evidence: Serious, nontransient treatment-related complications were not reported.
